instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: help with an acer la-j871p
threads.message: i am new to repairing non-apple motherboards. this boards has a problem with +3valp. I was getting a low resistance to ground on the rail and i injected 1v. the pch got warm so removed it. the short seemed to be gone but +3valp is still missing. i'm getting 5v on +5valp.  DB1 is two pin diode that send the enabled signal. it has mainpwon at 3.3v on one side and <SIGNAL>3V_EN</SIGNAL> is 0v on the other side

threads.title: help with an acer la-j871p
threads.message:
I supposse <SIGNAL>3V_EN_R</SIGNAL> is missing.
KBC may be damaged too, or needs reflash.
Check first if all its required signals and power are good.

threads.title: help with an acer la-j871p
threads.message: <SIGNAL>3V_EN_R</SIGNAL> is missing. does the pch need to be on the board for <SIGNAL>3V_EN_R</SIGNAL> to go high?

threads.title: help with an acer la-j871p
threads.message:
This signal comes out from KBC, not PCH.
3V3 controller powers both of them and KBC may also be affected; in case of overspike.
Read again my previous post...
